title: Coming to Terms: Private-Equity Investors Face Rising Costs, Extra Fees
sub_head: Fund-formation costs have risen sharply and some expenses historically covered by annual fees have shifted directly to investors
body:
Private equity has long been among the most expensive asset classes for investors, and itâ€™s not getting any cheaper.
The costs of forming private-equity funds are rising and investors are also being asked to foot the bill for certain expenses that historically were covered by fund managers, according to a recent report from the Institutional Limited Partners Association, a trade organization for investors in private-markets funds. The report, which was viewed by WSJ Pro Private Equity, included survey data from 76 investors...
